content:
Here is a table of all the motions presented by Giorgio Mammoliti during the year 2006:

| Type of Motion | Motion | Month, Year | Vote Result | Times Presented | Summary |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Public Safety | Motion to Request the Province to Increase Fines for Speeding | January, 2006 | Not passed, vote 5-37 | 6th time presented | Giorgio Mammoliti proposed to request the province to increase fines for speeding to improve traffic safety. |
| Housing | Motion to Request the Province to Provide Funding for Affordable Housing | February, 2006 | Not passed, vote 14-27 | 7th time presented | Giorgio Mammoliti proposed to request the province to provide funding for affordable housing in Toronto to address homelessness and the lack of affordable housing. |
| Public Safety | Motion to Increase Police Presence in North York | March, 2006 | Not passed, vote 10-29 | 1st time presented | Giorgio Mammoliti proposed to increase police presence in North York to improve public safety. |
| Community Support | Motion to Request Funding for the North York Community Preservation Panel | April, 2006 | Passed unanimously | 1st time presented | Giorgio Mammoliti proposed to request funding for the North York Community Preservation Panel to support heritage preservation in his ward. |
| Public Safety | Motion to Request Funding for a Gang Prevention Program | May, 2006 | Not passed, vote 10-28 | 1st time presented | Giorgio Mammoliti proposed to request funding for a gang prevention program to address gang-related crime in Toronto. |
| Public Safety | Motion to Install a Traffic Signal on Jane Street | June, 2006 | Passed unanimously | 3rd time presented | Giorgio Mammoliti proposed to install a traffic signal on Jane Street to improve traffic safety. |
| Housing | Motion to Request the Province to Provide Funding for Affordable Housing | September, 2006 | Not passed, vote 13-24 | 8th time presented | Giorgio Mammoliti proposed to request the province to provide funding for affordable housing in Toronto to address homelessness and the lack of affordable housing. |
| Public Safety | Motion to Request a Police Substation in North York | October, 2006 | Not passed, vote 9-28 | 2nd time presented | Giorgio Mammoliti proposed to request a police substation in North York to improve public safety. |
| Community Support | Motion to Rename Weston Road Park after Paul J. Rush | November, 2006 | Passed unanimously | 1st time presented | Giorgio Mammoliti proposed to rename Weston Road Park after Paul J. Rush to honor his contributions to the community. |
| Public Safety | Motion to Request Funding for a Gang Prevention Program | December, 2006 | Not passed, vote 11-28 | 2nd time presented | Giorgio Mammoliti proposed to request funding for a gang prevention program to address gang-related crime in Toronto. |

I hope this table provides the information you were looking for. Let me know if you have any further questions.
